official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act to increase the availability of
			 pesticides for the management of parasitic pests that adversely impact the
			 health of managed pollinator bees, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Expedited registration of pesticides for management of parasitic pests adversely impacting managed
			 pollinator bee health

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 2(o) of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act/s:2/ss:o

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

quote.#tail:
means any bee that is raised and housed in a managed hive or other appropriate housing and used
			 for honey production, managed pollination of crops, or breeding for
			 commercial purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 3(c)(10) of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act/s:3/ss:c/p:10

header.#text: Expedited registration of pesticides To improve managed pollinator bee health

text.#text: in subparagraph (B), by adding at the end the following new clause:
Improve managed pollinator bee health, including managing resistance to parasitic pests.
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act/s:33

text.#text:
An application for registration or an amendment that is reasonably expected to improve the health
			 of managed pollinator bees, including managing resistance to parasitic
			 pests of managed pollinator bees, shall qualify for expedited review
			 according to subparagraph (B) pursuant to the applicable decision time
			 review period under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Agriculture of the House of
			 Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report that addresses the extent and scope of the threat
			 to the health of managed pollinator bees from—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry
			 of the Senate

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

pathological factors, including the species of parasitic mite known as Varroa mite (Varroa
			 destructor), other arthropod pests, and fungal, microbial, and viral
			 diseases; and

environmental factors, including the habitat, forage, beekeeper practices and husbandry, and
			 nutritional needs of managed pollinator bees.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the
			 Environmental Protection Agency

Committee on
			 Agriculture of the House of Representatives

Committee on
			 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

the availability of pesticides for management of parasitic pests that adversely impact the health
			 of managed pollinator bees, particularly including the Varroa mite (Varroa
			 destructor); and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to expedite approvals of new products to control
			 parasitic pests of managed pollinator bees, including products to mitigate
			 resistance to products currently available.

quote.#tail:
means any bee that is raised and housed in a managed hive or other appropriate housing and used
			 for honey production, managed pollination of crops, or breeding for
			 commercial purposes.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5447 IH: To amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act to increase the availability of pesticides for the management of parasitic pests that adversely impact the health of managed pollinator bees, and for other purposes.
